And the steps can be difficult climbing up to the 3rd floor, however the clerk on duty helped carry my bags upstairs. There is parking though right outside the 2nd floor rooms. There are a lot of trains going by (they stop at the pier) all day long and

Best beach "penthouse" experience ever!  Perfect accommodations. Perfect kitchen set up. Perfect spacious bedrooms. Absolutely perfect everything!  Will return for many years to come.   Thank you Seahorse!

Summary Heading: Beautiful view, great location, but needs updating.
Summary: I was really excited to stay this close to the pier in San Clemente.  If I'm coming to a beach town, I'm usually willing to pay extra for the view. Based on the pictures here on tripadvisor I knew I would get a stunning view.  And I did.  We stayed in a one-bedroom queen suite with wrap around views, a tiny balcony that never got sunlight, and although you felt like you were in a fishbowl for other people to see in your room, the view of the pier and the sunset was unbelievable.  It was fantastic.  Had the surf been better and the wind died down it would have been perfect (as a surf spot), but that was not the fault of the hotel.  We grabbed pizza at the pizza place and drinks from the market 50 feet from the entrance and brought it back to our room.  In the morning we walked

We loved our stay at the Seahorse. The location was amazing with a parking spot and a hall access to the street and the beach right across. We loved the ocean views, smell of the sea in the open windows. Provide beach chairs and umbrella that were super helpful.  The beds were comfortable and the kitchen was stocked with what you need to prepare meals(minus food). The building we stayed in was Villa Del Mar. It was older, but clean and modern decor. Love the view.

My sisters and I stayed at the Seahorse Resort for several nights recently. We found and booked online so didn't really know what we were getting in advance. We absolutely LOVED our one-bedroom villa directly across the street from the beach and the San Clemente Pier. The beds were comfortable as was the sofa. We ate our dinners on the generous deck with the sound of crashing waves in the background. I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope for a return visit.

Beautiful view, close to the water and a few restaurants.  The coastal trail was great.  I walked it every morning as well as ran up and down the stairs a few times.  I also would have rented a bicycle to get around if I had known

What a wonderful place. Beautiful sunsets, great restaurants on the pier within walking distance.  Fall asleep to the sound of the waves.  Clean rooms, great staff!! I highly recommend this spot for relaxation good food and great beaches.

The location and the king-bed suite accommodations with full kitchenette was fantastic. Literally one block from the ocean with great balcony, easy parking, Wifi, large living room, great bed, perfect pillows. We stayed three nights and could have stayed for a week! PS: Hotels.com gave us the best price compared to a number of other websites, saving us $40 a night. PPS: the manager called us a few days out to ask what our needs were and when we would arrive. Great Boutique Hotel Service.  Not really a bad experience, but FYI: this place is older, dated decor, with an "undulating floor" and thin walls. But all that did not bother us at all. Definitely would stay here again!

My husband was lucky enough to grab a room for a last-minute getaway for my birthday last weekend.  After checking some YELP reviews, he took all into consideration, and after speaking with staff, he felt comfortable in booking our stay.  We had Room 8, a lower level room with a patio overlooking the pier and beach.  The weather was lovely so we spent much of our time on our patio enjoying the sun, people, surfers and enjoying our wine and beer.  The room itself was clean and nicely appointed, with a front room with a (very comfortable) couch, chair and television, and a king-sized bed in the next room.  There was also a refrigerator, coffee maker and a large chest of drawers.  There were ceiling fans in both rooms.  We found the bed very comfortable and our stay was quiet.  The

Stayed here in November for the weekend, great ocean view, rooms have unique beach style, great staff. Does not provide breakfast so go across the street and eat fresh seafood by the pier!... loved it!

I stayed here for a couple of nights, with my sisters, for my oldest sisters 60th birthday.  The view was amazing...right across the street from the Pier.  The villa was very clean & spacious, with a nice balcony, high end beds/bedding, ... All we needed & more!  Excellent choice of accommodations!  Great memories made!

Summary Heading: A view that will take your breath away!
Summary: Great private little boutique hotel across from the pier.  The room was nothing fancy but comfortable, had a private balcony and the view was amazing.  The staff was quite friendly and helpful and covered parking near the room was a pleasant surprise.  Can't wait to do again!    Enjoyed wandering the streets of this quaint little area. A local breakfast favorite is La Galette Creperie provides street side dining right down the street.

My fiancee and I went to the Seahorse Resort for the weekend after New Years and were incredibly, pleasantly surprised.  Beautiful does not begin to describe the views from the hotel... the sunsets you will experience are truly breathtaking.  The rooms are spacious and well kept and the staff is very nice and accommodating.  Highly recommended for vacation or just to get out of San Diego or LA for a weekend.  Oh and the bed is ridiculously comfortable... we are looking to buy the same one for our house now.

I stayed at the Seahorse resort last weekend and I was very happy I did! Even though I arrived at nighttime the view was amazing! The cool sea breeze, the sound of the waves and the beautiful view of San Clemente greeted me when I arrived! I stayed on the bottom floor , suite #8, which my patio looked out toward the pier and ocean!! Spectacular views! It is a dog friendly resort and the people that run the place were very friendly and welcoming! I would definetly stay there again...but I think I would like to try the 2nd or 3rd story ....for the view and a little more privacy! They also had a few really good restaurants a couple doors down and I know that one of them for sure were pet friendly also! I will most certainly be back!!

Great, well equipped apartment ,close to good restaurants and the beach. Very comfortable and spacious. Our apartment overlooked the beach and had two balconies with comfy chairs. Parking was available below the apartments.

Summary Heading: Great weekend trip to San Clemente
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Seahorse for a long weekend. San Clemente is 60 miles from San Diego and about 30 miles from Legoland, and not far from Disneyland, so it's a good place to have as a base when visiting southern California.  The hotel is right across the street from the beach and our room had the best beach and ocean views. The suite was spacious, clean and modern. There was a kitchen, cable TV and Wifi access.   I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend this place.

Looking for beachlocation at reasonable price? Search no more. Great views of the pier and beach. The room was actually an appartment with full kitchen and living room plus a balcony. Family vacation with 4 would be comfortable for sure, for 2 people it was a bit extra luxury. The managment pictures are a fair representation - quaint beach decor and all.  Shopping and lots of restaurants within easy walking distance and the beach is right across the street. The street itsself is not super busy but there is a trainstation served by amtrak and metrolink. The trains didn't bother us and it made for a great daytrip into San Diego (or into LA if you went the other direction). Windows were goog (nice and quiet) and with the bedroom away from the street we got a good nights rest and

We loved this place! Great views! The only downer was the trains that come through every so often ..even late at night.  Other than that it was great!  Lots of shops an restaurants near by..The Fishermans restaurant across the street is a nice perk with good food and seating on the pier. Honeymoon at the Seahorse was a special place! Great views, comfy bed. We will be back!

Rooms were spotless and the room furniture really was are a unique and quaint throwback to my ocean experiences in New England, where I am from.  Staff was so responsive, especially Oksana, (the owner?), who was constantly attentive to details throughout the day.  I will definitely be back.  Such a terrific alternative to a mass market franchise beach hotel.  Strongly recommend.

I wrote a negative review 2 years ago but after updating of the room, have nothing negative to say. The rooms were immaculate and love the updated suite.  They really have a gem here.  Shops and restaurants close by, beach and pier right across the street. Can't wait to return!

Summary Heading: Great view in a great spot with parking included
Summary: Seahorse Resorts owns several buildings right along the pier/ocean front in San Clemente.  We stayed in a one bedroom villa with an ocean front view and balcony.  True the rooms do need upgrades, but for what we paid we got great value for money.  Imagine sipping a mimosa while you people watch and enjoy the beautiful ocean view.  This is what you're paying for with this property.  Many restaurants in very short walking distance (right across the street and right below the property in most cases).  There was also a small market which had necessary items if you want to have breakfast in one morning or take alcohol back to your room.  I highly recommend this property.  Some people may say the Amtrak/train line in front of the hotel is a downside, but it was actually quite cool

This hotel has a fantastic location.  Directly across the street from the beach and an easy stroll to the San Clemente pier. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was pleasant and helpful.  We took advantage of the balcony overlooking the ocean to sit, relax, and take pictures of the sunsets.    Sleeping was comfortable as we kept the door open and the ceiling fan on.  We listened to the waves through the night.  There is a railroad that is quite active and runs between the beach and the hotel.  During the day the train whistles are very common but at night they were not a problem at all.  As others have said, the rooms are a little dated but this is not uncommon for a beach hotel.  Our room had a large screen HD TV with many channels.  We also had access to free

Right on the main drag in San Clemente, across from the pier and beach.  Older hotel, but nice...great value for the location and view!  Would recommend for couples.  San Clemente is a laid-back beach community, and the Seahorse Resort reflects that vibe.

We come at least twice a year. This place is just perfect! The prices are reasonable and you can't beat the location! Customer service has always been great as well! The rooms are always clean and nice. There is a little market just steps away for food and other necessities. The beach is just outside!

Summary Heading: Great location, could use some TLC
Summary: The location of the Seahorse is great.  Right across from the pier, an easy walk to the beach is great.  The rooms seemed pretty clean, they just needed some TLC.  The room I had just seemed a little used, and in need of some maintenance.  Maybe a little updating, and some attention to detail would boost the score to a 4 or 5

Summary Heading: Looking for a place to stay and endeed up at the SeaHorse
Summary: Seahorse is simple non pretentious and a great ocean front location near the pier in San Clemente.  No the Ritz but a beach bums delight.  Defines ocean front casual at reasonable prices - a hard to find combination - unlock your inner beach bum fantasy

The vieew from Room 3 at the resort was awesome,but the room needs updating.TV didnt work when we first got there and some of the lights did not work. The bedroos which is completely seperate did not have a TV in it which I thought was unusual for this type of Hotel.The shower is extremely small that if your 6'3 like me you have to squeeze into it.Staff was helpful and friendly. Just down the street is a great brekfast place and across the street excellent Seafood restaurant.If they were to upgrade room I would stay again.Train at night with horn will wake you up

Set up our friends from chilly NY for a two night stay. Pacific Room 3 floor Queen with Private Balcony!! Perfect to relax, listen to the waves and zone out!! They also offer free beach chairs, towels and umbrellas if you want to sit in the sand. Ocean and San Clemente Pier view. Great hospitality on the part of the staff!!!

The location was awesome. We had a ground level unit which did not have much privacy because people were walking by all the time but we loved how easy it was to get to the beach so once we got use to it we loved it. We spend time surfing and playing in the water. We ate at the pier. I jogged in the morning along the ocean front trail and we walked on the pier in the evening. The kids loved walking down the street to buy ice cream and things from the connivence  store. My son also enjoyed fishing from the pier. Overall we loved this hotel. Spacious and nicely decorated.  We enjoyed eating at the table across the street. Nice table on a grassy area.

We moved to this hotel after checking out of a busy chain hotel that we decided defeated the purpose of staying in a beach town. (Too far from the water) Extremely glad we decided to make the move to the Seahorse.   We had a one bedroom on the first floor that looked out onto the pier. Everyday we could lookout and watch the sun rise or set. The king size bed was comfortable and the room came equipped with a kitchen which was great for storing our water, and wine.   This is a great location, restaurants are walking distance as well as the pier. Free parking, and wifi are also included in the rate.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with awesome customer service!
Summary: I read other reviews on Trip Advisor before booking at the Seahorse.  And those that mentioned Oksana underestimated how awesome this woman is.  First of all, I was freaking out after breakfast because I couldn't find my room key and was in a rush to meet a friend. When I went into the office to explain, Oksana smiled and said 'no problem' and gave me another key.  Also, she went out of her way and was very helpful in helping me find a parking spot on the street as I was having a friend visit me and would use my reserved spot that comes with the room.  Oksana is a perfect fit for the Seahorse because she really cares about the guests that stay there.  I already booked another weekend there because I can't imagine better service anywhere else in that area.

Summary Heading: Charming and Quirky, with Good Value
Summary: This European-style inn faces the ocean in San Clemente, with excellent views from all of the rooms. Our “studio” accommodation on the first floor (actually two small rooms) was stylishly decorated. A sitting room with glass doors opened to a street-level patio and ocean vistas. Behind an interior wall, the sleeping area featured a supremely comfortable king bed, along with a simple bathroom and separate shower, a microwave, small refrigerator and coffee maker. A number of decent restaurants could be found just a few steps down the sidewalk. A private garden for guests on a hill adjacent to the main building offered panoramic views of the sea.  Along with of the Seahorse Resort's charms, there were some quirks -- a shoulder-high shower head, and a toilet paper dispenser that was

This place has the best views and located next to some amazing places to eat. I would love to go back. I'm planing on taking the girlfriend. I have family stay here when they come to visit.  The staff is fun and very accommodating. It's the best spot to stay in san Clemente.

My husband and I were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with balcony and loved it. We will come back again some day we hope. Loved the quiet and view and wonderfully helpful staff. Especially Oxsana. She is the manager and was so kind and friendly. The beach is right across the street and cafes are right downstairs, parking behind the room and gorgeous sunsets every night. Just wonderful!

This review is really overdue but I wanted to still get something posted. We arrived in San Clemente having called ahead on the day and when we saw the accommodation at first we weren't sure. I ran up and down the street looking at the other limited available options and we decided to stay. We hesitated at first because we thought the price was bit high for motel style accommodation and there were renovations underway. We stayed in the building next to the main building with the office. But we were so happy we stayed! Everyone was really nice, the kitchen was a great bonus, the terraces with sun lounger, and table and chairs was wonderful and having a living area to relax in proved much better than a nice hotel room. You get beach chairs and umbrella and beach towels to use for

Summary Heading: Great location, great staff, sunset views and a kitchen!
Summary: This is one of our favorite places in all of Orange County. Its location near the San Clemente pier couldn't be more convenient. It's also close to downtown, which is full of fun shops, bars and restaurants. The staff is great (especially Oksana). They go out of their way to accommodate guests and make things special. When Oksana knew that we were celebrating our anniversary, she had a bottle of wine ready for us. The views of the beach, ocean and pier are incredible from the large balcony and living room. To top it all off, this place has a kitchen so we can cook our own meals. While the rooms are a little older, they're still nice, clean and you can't beat the price. No wonder Sunset magazine just did a little write-up on the Sea Horse. I'm almost afraid to write a good review

Our first visit to California, we were very lucky to find this "jewel" of a hotel on the internet. Oksana was excellent when we needed backup, she sorted out a couple of major problems for us (nothing to do with the accomodation!). The views from the deck were superb!-the best sunsets we have ever seen- ask for suite 8 'Sunset'. There is a very good place for American breakfast within a short walk - be prepared to put on a few pounds! The beach trails provide for relaxed and non-strenuous walks. If it wasn't so far from the UK, we would be booking a return trip now.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Location, Wonderful Room, Wonderful Staff
Summary: We are first time visitors to this section of California, having passed through Joshua Tree National Park and the back road mountain passes to San Clemente.  It was a wonderful trip from the Phoenix area!!  We had found the Sea Horse on Trip Advisor, and we were pleased to find that they allowed us to stop with our small dog for a small fee.  Our arrival was just before sunset, and the staff was welcoming and helpful in locating carry out for the evening.  Our room was on the first floor, and it had a very nice front porch with table, chairs and umbrella.  Some might not like the sidewalk right beside it, or the street close by.  But that did not bother us at all.  There was a great view out to the beach, and also to the pier.  Bring binoculars and you can even see Naval vessels

In our recent visit to this hotel we walked into the reserved room assigned to us; took a quick look around, & headed for the Seahorse office. The room was located off a dingy hallway, that gave off a very seedy , &  uncompfortable feeling; to say nothing about the price of the room for a three day stay. The view from this room was that of the pier & the roof top of the Fisherman's Restaurant. There also was a construction project underway in the adjacent hotel. The end result was an "upgrade" to another room with a clear view of the ocean in the other Sea Horse Hotel close by. On the plus side of our experience the office manager was very understanding, went out of her way to accommodate us. We are hoping that our next experience with the Sea Hoarse Hotel will find the

The location and view are outstanding here, and San Clemente is the perfect California beach village.  Oksana is a jewel of a hotel manager: extremely helpful and caring.  I actually like the frequent trains, as they are part of the Cal beach setting.  There are great restaurants in walking distance and the San Clemente trail lets you walk or bike along the ocean for endless miles.  In September, we left our door open with only screen to feel the breezes and the sound of the ocean during the night.  They let you use beach towels, chairs, and umbrellas.  We will definitely be back when we are in the area and hope that Oksana is there!!

Alba & Oksana are the best. We had the most beautiful view from top floor Penthouse Unit. 2bd, 2bth. super clean, comfortable and convienent location. Train goes by alot but not in the middle of the night, actually fun to watch. This is a great place to come celebrate a special occasion or no occasion at all. Fully equipped kitchen with everything you could possible need. If there's anything else you need, just ask. Staff is very very accomodating. Can't wait for the sun deck to be ready. We all already miss the sound of the waves crashing. We will be back soon.

Best location in SC. Only spent one night here, but the room was very clean and kept up quite well given the age of the property. The trains can be noisy, but if you close the windows and turn on the a/c at night, the noise goes away. The balcony was a wonderful place to sit back and enjoy the sunset from our deck. It was also fun to watch the beach activity and the different trains passing by or stopping. Being able to walk across the street to have dinner on the water was great. Parking for 1 car was available outside our unit. Thank you Oksana, property manager, for making this a great getaway stay.

Summary Heading: Ok if you have low standards
Summary: Semi dirty rooms. Fully equipped kitchen had some broken things.  If it was disclosed, that food have helped.  It was after a spending spree and we attempted to use the oven. I had even bought pans. All to find out, no go on oven. Toaster was a dud as well. Furnishings were likely purchased at goodwill or a yard sale. The rooms lacked central air conditioning. The unit on the wall worked if you sat right near it. But created a puddle on the patio that created a risk for someone slipping. Very sparse in towels. Office closes. Therefore, there is no one to call after hours for any issues that may arise. Even the newly remodeled room lacks some basic things.  But it's across the street from the beach.  It has beautiful views. So just depends what that's worth to you.

The location was ideal.  Beautiful views. Easy access to the pier and beach. BUT....i wish someine had told us about the trains!!!  We knew the track was right there. But the horns and the amount of trains passing by was just too much.  Staff was fantastic. But when someone is booking a room they should be warned about the trains and the beach being very rocky.  Bring your water shoes if you have even the slightest of sensitive feet. Otherwise loved it.

Friends and family had a marvelous six days across from the San Clemente pier. The location is perfect--great beach and everything within walking distance. Friendly service from Oksana & her staff made us feel welcome .They met all our requests for extras . The rooms are light , uncluttered, very comfortable  and clean .

Unfortunately, do to a work issue, I had to cancel my reservation with this hotel.  However, this was not within the 2 week window that is required by the hotel.  When I called and spoke with Oksana, she was lovely and sweet, but was required to adhere to the managements strict cancellation policy, which is two weeks cancellation notice or the deposit (equal to one night's stay) is forfeited.  While I understand that being a small hotel it is necessary to be able to recover from the loss of a room booking, unfortunately, there are unforeseen circumstances.  I was able to rebook the room (which was going to be at a different rate because I had booked as special and the window of time for that special had passed).  Unfortunately, I was not able to keep that reservation, but since

Summary Heading: Relax and Breathe the Sea Air
Summary: Great little resort across from San Clemente Pier.  Rooms are comfy, sort of a "throw-back" to the 50's and 60's style with a great deck overlooking the Southern California coastline.  The Proprietor's were so friendly and quick to assist you with any question or need you might have.  I'll look forward to staying here again---hopefully sooner rather than later

great balconies looking over in the ocean .[from across the street] in many rooms.Easy stroll to pier. reasonable price.   Awkward room set ups, cinderblock walls, small,dated bathrooms, had to request  enough towels for our party of 3. One "suite"for 3 people had a separate bedroom for 2, and a twin bed in the main  room, that's great. BUT, ... to get to the bathroom you have to go through the other bedroom!!!!!AWKWARD !!  lumpy ,old mattresses, sheets falling off the bed. No suitcase stands. Office was very pleasant when we made requests..., then took forever to deliver.

Our little family had wonderful stay at Seahorse Resort. It was beyond ideal! The room was clean, spacious, and owners are fabulous. We had studio and after getting our 1 year old to bed enjoyed carefree sushi dinner on the deck enjoying the sights and sounds of being the pier. Cannot beat location or the price. Next time were in San Clemente we'll be back.

I couldn't have had a better weekend getaway.  After speaking with Oksana on the phone it was everything she advised!!  Great view, top floor best.  Staff was exceptional and added touch of hotel providing umbrellas, beach chairs and towels was wonderful.  Anything we needed it was there in two seconds flat.  The office door was always open and very inviting making you feel very much at home.  All shops and food within walking distance.  We re-booked before we left. Oksana is the BOMB!!!!   MUST VISIT.

We were exceptionally happy to have found the Seahorse Resort.  After a week in Disney, we were looking to spend a couple of days relaxing on the coast.  We found exactly that and more.  Our two teenagers suggested that we should have stayed here for the week and only a couple of days in disney instead.  The condo was adorable, charming, super clean and the views were second to none.  We loved the layout, spaciousness, all the windows with that view!  We were in unit 2 with 2 balconies, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths and an extra twin bed. This was perfect for travelling with two teenagers as everyone had their own space.  Yes, there are trains on the coast but the sound of the ocean more than makes up for them.  We would highly recommend and are making plans for a return trip as soon as

Summary Heading: We found a gem but could not enjoy it
Summary: Well, we were just too happy and excited to have found this nice resort with what must be the best view you can get for their rates. In that way I still recommend it.  Our experience is personal, but something to keep in mind for more travelers, I can't imagine being the only one bumping into these obstacles.  Since their own bookingsite was down, I made reservations trough a booking site. Only to be greatly dissappointed afterwards.  The bookingsite sold us an oceanview room and stated that extra bed could be provided, but this is only for the ground floor units (still view but not the ones you get as advertised). When you want to enjoy the view and the privacy (ground patio's are practically on the street from what I understand), of course a room in higher level is better. But

My first thought was to take my wife for a Valentine's Day dinner in San Clemente at one of our favorite places, Fisherman's on the San Clemente Pier. To add to our weekend. I began to look for a hotel to stay at for Presidents weekend that was not to costly.   I was able to find just the right place in the Seahorse Resort. The Seahorse was far less costly than the motel across the street. Thing is both locations shared the same wonderful beach and pier view. Only we had a bargain price.  The young lady Ms. Oksana placed us in a studio on the first floor ( # 9 Catalina Room) which had a very good view along with everything that made us feel very comfortable for our stay.   The Seahorse Resort is within walking distance to restaurants, and local friendly bars.  I highly recommend

Just returned home to San Diego after a two day stay at the Seahorse with my wife and another couple. We stayed in unit number two which afforded us absolutely beautiful views from each of our two balconies.The unit itself was clean, spacious and had all necessary amenities Our room had its own bathroom and balcony...my wife insisted upon closing the sliding glass door at night because the sound of the waves was keeping her awake. A nice problem to have,I'd say! There are a few quaint little restaurants as well as a convenience (very convenient) store right down the street. Beyond these few businesses and a handful of hotels there is not much else there....and that's a great thing....relatively unspoiled and very quaint!    Every single person from the resort that we had the

Summary Heading: A room to match the great view
Summary: My husband and I spent a mid-week night at the Seahorse and were very pleased with just about everything about it. A gorgeous view of the Pacific and the San Clemente pier, a comfortable, spacious room with wrap-around picture windows, newly updated bathroom fixtures, a nice little kitchen, close to the pier, restaurants, Amtrak station, and beach trail, very pleasant and helpful office people, and a (small) west-facing deck. The only negatives we found were relatively minor: a round toilet, rather than oval and window coverings in the bedroom that let in too much light from the outside lighting at night. This is an older lodging that has undergone recent renovations, which are nicely done, but there are some limitations re: space (e.g., the bath) that would be expensive to

My wife and I were recently married, and for our honeymoon we decided to spend some time in southern California. Myself originally being from San Diego , I knew San Clemente was a hidden gem to begin with. I was looking for something special, but I was trying desperately to stay within a reasonable budget. I really wanted to impress my new bride.   After a lot of searching, I came across the Seahorse Resort. I was really surprised by the price, and instantly I started wondering why it was so inexpensive (considering the unbeatable location). I began reading all the reviews, most going on and on about how great the place was. There were, of course, a few that had their complaints. While I was initially concerned about some of the things they said, the larger amount of positive

I spent three nights in this property with my parents.  It overlooks the beach and our two bedroom/2 bathroom suite had the most amazing views of the pier and the ocean.  The living room/kitchen faced towards the ocean and the entire west wall is windows so that nothing obstructs the view!  Even the master bedroom has a huge window that faces the water.  There are also two decks with ocean views.  It was a perfect place to kick back and relax for a couple of days.  You are literally steps away from the beach and the famous pier.  The owners, Oxsana and the rest of the staff, are polite, friendly and incredibly accommodating.  There was three of us staying in this suite, but it could have easily slept 7+ with all the beds and fold-up cots.  Definitely a place we will be returning

My husband and I stayed at the Sea Horse Resort the first week of November as our anniversary gift to ourselves. I have to say we now have a new favorite place! We had the Marina Suite on the second floor and the view is fabulous from the living area, the kitchen, and the balcony. The beach and pier were just across the street and easily accessible. The suite was completely stocked with dishes, coffe pot, microwave, etc. and very clean and tidy, the furniture was comfortable.Service was great and the staff was very friendly. We are planning a family holiday at the resort because it has everything you need for a great vacation: Terrific suite-check, plenty of room-check, beach two minutes away-check, low key beach town-check, fun for grown-ups-check, fun for kids-check,

I actually have not stayed at the Sea Horse Resort yet, but I just made my reservation.  I have been looking for a place to celebrate our anniversary and stumbled on this property by accident.  I called to inquire about pet policy and was helped on the phone by Oxsana.  She was so friendly and engaging and answered all my questions for thoroughly.  I immediately made my reservation, simply due to our conversation.  Looking forward to a lovely time when we visit next month.

We were greeted by Oxana, a petite, bubbly, and friendly person who just felt she had to make everyone feel welcome. She showed us our ground floor suite, which we found clean, recently updated, and decorated simply. That suite has only a shower, but that was fine for us. It also had a small fridge and microwave, and a coffee maker. The location across from the beach was ideal, and beach chairs, umbrellas, and towels are on loan from the simple lobby; free! We also had free parking on site, and if you've been to San Clemente beach you'll appreciate how valuable that feature is on its own! We'd come back if we could.

Spent 2 days and nights . Great location ,very friendly staff ,free use of beach chairs and beach towels. 1 minute walk to the beach and pier. Lots of great food close by. great surfing and swimming beach. Free Dedicated parking right at the hotel We will be back as soon as we can with the rest of the family for sure !

25 years I first went to Seahorse with a couple of trips in between. Location cannot be beat. Across from beach, walk up the hill to great little commercial area, rent a board and a wetsuit, walk/run the beach trail, and a train stop right across the street. The building was getting tired but improvements are being made. Our room had new windows, kitchen, bathroom and floor. It was home. Cleaning staff is daily and worthy of a bouquet. Even when I said don't bother, a quick kitchen, bathroom cleanup. Oksana is great reception. Sure ... she up sold me at reservation time, but bless her for doing so. Our usual bachelor suite was forgotten for spacious one bedroom and kitchen. We didn't leave for a week except to get groceries and take-out pizza down the street. Thanks.

Stayed at the Sea Horse for our anniversary.  What a deal.  The room I reserved was already taken so they upgraded me to a one bedroom suite with a kitchen and a spectacular view of the Pacific Ocean.  Loved, Loved, it!  Room looked like it was recently re-done.  Clean and very comfortable.  Within walking distance to the main drag.  Quiet.  Free parking on the premises.  Couldn't have asked for more.  Will definitely return.

We loved our recent stay at the Seahorse Resort for our Anniversary. Being just across the street from the beach is wonderful to be able to enjoy walks and sunset views. San Clemente is charming and filled with great, unique shops and restaurants. So lucky to have discovered this pretty beach town and charming resort. A big thanks to all the staff and owners at The Seahorse who made us feel so welcome.
Manager Response: Happy Anniversary! We're thrilled to have been the special spot for your romantic getaway. We love to hear that couples and families keep coming back to the Sea Horse to celebrate special occasions and start new traditions -it truly is an honor for us.  The sunsets this month have been so amazing; they never ceases to mesmerize. We can never quite capture the beauty of our sunsets in photos, but we keep trying in hopes others will be lured into this magical little town of ours. It really does have everything to offer...  We can't wait to welcome you back soon!

Summary: The view is the reason you stay at this hotel.  We had the #4 Penthouse and could not have asked for a better view.  It was large enough with 2 bedrooms and bathrooms, couch, etc. This resort could use some TLC, paint, doors, screens on the windows and sliding doors.  Our room was full of little flies.  The banisters on the deck, chairs and table were dirty and need a good cleaning before guests arrive.  Was great they had towels, umbrellas, and chairs for the beach which was right across the street.  It is on the pricey side for what you get but I guess you are paying for the view and convenience.
Manager Response: The incredible ocean views from our suites are definitely worth it, especially from one of our 2 bedroom suites. These suites are 1400 square feet of comfort, easily sleeping 5-6 guests. With 2 separate bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 oceanfront balconies, a fully equipped kitchen and a spacious living room, you won't need much else to enjoy your stay in beautiful San Clemente...  ...Well, maybe some beach gear to enjoy the tranquil sounds of the ocean. We happily provide complimentary beach towels, chairs, umbrellas and sand toys to all guests.   We thank you for your comments and we do hear you - we're making exciting upgrades to all of our suites and can't wait for you to come back and enjoy an even better Sea Horse experience!   Oh,by the way... we don't want to leave anyone in the family out of enjoying a vacation in San Clemente at the Sea Horse, which is why we're happy to welcome your furry kids too - we're dog friendly :)

Summary: Beautiful ocean view across from San Clemente's historic pier. Great friendly and capable management. Quaint rooms. Near great eateries.  Been going for several years and love it.  Have recommended it to my friends.  Dog friendly too.  Great place.
Manager Response: Uh-oh... we may have stolen your phrase because we also find ourselves referring to the Sea Horse and San Clemente as our little slice of paradise! We're so happy to hear you think so too.   Everything you need during your stay is either in your suite or a short stroll away. San Clemente has the best to offer, from beautiful beaches to delicious cuisine and fun shopping :)   We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great weekend in San Clemente, Ca.
Summary: Kind of an old hotel, but the location is great, the main st with lots of shops and restaurants about 4 blocks away. Had a great time with friends. View from room #2 was great, very close to the pier, they lend you towels and chairs for the beach, no swimming pool.
Manager Response: Our 2 bedroom suites are definitely a great idea if you're coming with a large family or a group of friends. You definitely can't beat the views from both of your private balconies!   Although we don't have a swimming pool on site, we like to say that we offer the biggest swimming pool ever right across the street - the majestic Pacific Ocean :) We just went for a swim the other day and saw a few friends about 40 feet away - a pod of 5 dolphins!   We are working harder than ever on completing upgrades to our suites - come back next year and you'll find wonderful new surprises. Also, keep an eye out for our new website coming soon - it will feature glimpses of the renovations to come! It's hard to contain our excitement :)  Thank you for your stay with us, The Mckinleys

Summary Heading: Seahorse Resort the best in San Clemente , Ca
Summary: Beautiful view from all rooms at the resort , great management , friendly accommodating and there to please you. I had a great stay right near the beach and Amtrak which is across the street. I go from Santa Barbara to San Clemente because my significant other lives there. I would recommend this place to one of my family or good friends....Gene Pagliaro  Santa Barbara , Ca
Manager Response: We've said it before and we'll say it again and again - we are honored to have so much of our business come from our repeat guests. It's always a pleasure catching up with our friends and hearing what's new.   Thank you so much for your continued visits! Hope you're keeping up with the painting, Pawcasso :)  p.s. - I can't believe what a coincidence - here we are catching up on responses to our wonderful guests, and you're staying here again this week! It's a pleasure having you back with us.

Summary Heading: Our recent visit to the Seahorse resort
Summary: This was our first visit to the Seahorse Resort, & we both enjoed our three day stay there. This is a family owned, and managed resort that was very receptive to our recent stay. We both felt that we were welcome, and our reservation was handled in a very friendly professional manner. We were pleased with our room accomodations along with a fantastic ocean view. We will definitely be back for another stay in October 2013. We highly recommend the Seahorse Resort to others seeking a friendly beach vacation.
Manager Response: It is one of our goals to make every guest feel right at home. We're delighted that you enjoyed your first stay with us and are very excited to see you both again soon! The weather is still fantastic and the sunsets are breathtaking this time of year.   We hear gray whale season is approaching - there's an awesome whale watching tour just a few minutes away from us that you could take advantage of during your next visit with us!  See you soon...

Summary Heading: Loved it - it is our new getaway spot!
Summary: We live just 15 minutes away, just not near ocean - so we found this online and booked for our anniversary. It is like an apartment really, not a hotel, as it has a full kitchen, living room, dining room, bedroom, bathroom, hallway, closets, and an OCEAN FRONT patio!!! From the living/dining room/kitchen - it is a wall of windows with AMAZING white water views all round. You are looking at the beautiful SC pier, the waves, the sand - it is breathtaking! You can listen to the waves at night - so romantic! Enjoy the beach, & restaurants short walk, seafood, cocktails - perfect! It is quiet, reasonable, has a lovely down to earth owner & staff, covered parking - u name it - has it all - was tremendous - our new getaway spot!
Manager Response: We couldn't be happier that you've found your "staycation" spot with us at the Sea Horse! One of the great amenities the Sea Horse has to offer is the fact that we're excellently suited for couples looking for a romantic getaway as well as families looking to make new memories together. We have different types of suites to accommodate our many types of guests.   The suite you stayed in is one of our favorites because, as you said, the wall of windows provides an unbeatable view of the ocean and waves! Leave your windows open and you'll fall asleep to the crashing waves - it almost makes you feel like you're on the sand!  We can't wait to welcome you back to your new home away from home :)

Summary: I recently stayed at the Seahorse Resort for a walk down memory lane as my husband (who passed way recently) and I lived near there 43 years ago. I totally enjoyed my stay, it was everything I had hoped for.  My queen size suite was spacious and had everything I needed.  The staff was very compassionate and extremely accommodating.  I especially liked the location, just a walk across the street to the beach and pier. There are many places nearby to eat or enjoy a beverage. (To refer to other comments, there are frequent trains passing by but they are only 6 car passenger trains that pass in 15 seconds... really not an issue.)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. It was a pleasure welcoming you back to your old stomping grounds! We love getting to know our guests and listening to their stories and memories, especially when we meet people who used to live here! It's always so fascinating to hear others' recollections of our little slice of paradise. We hope to welcome you again many times in the future - have a wonderful rest of your year!

Summary: We stayed at SeaHorse Resort for a week...it had the most amazing view of the ocean, best view on the pier. Staff were friendly, and helpful. I liked being able to walk across the street to the beach.  The one bedroom was large and spacious, on site parking was convienient.  We highly recommend this resort, we plan on renting it again next year. The wall of windows gave us the feeling of being right on the beach, and you can hear the surf in your window, loved watching the surfers and people playing on the beach. Jim and Jean Morefield
Manager Response: It was so nice meeting you both during your stay with us this past spring! We think the picture windows in our suites may be the best amenity - everyone always comments they feel like they're sitting on the sand looking out to the ocean, all while in the comfort of their suite's living room. We're so happy you were able to take in the fresh ocean air and relax during your stay here at the Sea Horse. Please come back and see us again soon - we'd love to catch up :)

Summary Heading: One of my favorite places ever!
Summary: I have returned to this little treasure twice since my original visit. I love this hotel. From it's laid back, helpful front desk guy to it's awesome french doors leading to the deck across the street from the ocean I couldn't find one thing wrong with this place, even if I tried. It's cozy, inexpensive, and gives you great views of the sunset from the porch, or even the bed. If I could, I'd return time and time again. I live over 1000 miles away, but if I were closer, I'd go for the weekend all the time. I can't say enough good about this place.
Manager Response: Reading your review really gets us excited about our jobs! It's such a pleasure for us to welcome you back to the Sea Horse. Repeat guests really are the heart of our business and we can't thank you enough for coming back to us. Our ground floor studios are such popular rooms for people who enjoy sitting on the sun deck, taking in the beautiful San Clemente weather, sunsets, and friendly passersby. We can't wait to see you again - have a wonderful summer!

Summary Heading: Location and View Can't Be Beat!
Summary: What a location! What a view! We stayed 2 nights in the Catalina room, ground floor studio with a great deck for watching the golden sunsets. Hotel service was great and they provide beach chairs and towels for guests' use. Rooms are a little tired and could use a little refreshing, especially bathrooms. We enjoyed the trains nearby, but with doors closed, it was very quiet inside our room. Bring your own hair dryer, but if you forget, you can borrow one from the front desk. Walk to everything nearby, and main drag is a short, but uphill, walk. If you want upscale luxury, this family-run, small, beachy hotel is not for you. If you want affordable, ocean view, no frills, but location, view, and comfort, book the Sea Horse.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We do have, in our humble opinion, a truly unique location here at the Sea Horse in San Clemente! From the quaint small town feel of our Spanish Village by the Sea, to the friendly local residents, San Clemente is a town worth visiting. We're delighted you agree that the Sea Horse is a great place to stay while you're exploring San Clemente!  We do our best to make our guests feel at home while they're with us and we do appreciate your feedback. In fact, we have started renovating our rooms - check out our website as we'll be posting pictures very soon! We're so excited for our guests to see the changes we've been making. Hope to see you back soon; we'll be happy to give you a tour of our updated suites.

Summary: Stayed for one night only suite 5A- Best cost x benefit on the beach In Califórnia ! Fantastic sunset view from the balconista of the large living room, Want to be back In the summer, if you are In doubt relax choose the Seahorse will be happy you did it.
Manager Response: We're so happy you enjoyed your night with us. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to San Clemente! Oh, we've just finished a complete renovation of your room, so you definitely have to come by and check it out. Pictures will be posted to our website soon. Have a great rest of your summer!

Summary: I'm surprised to see any positive reviews. People can't really want to put up with that kind of filth and poor service. The reviews made me think it was an okay place to stay. The furniture and carpets were so dirty, we wouldn't even put our suitcases on them. The Seahorse is in dire need of renovation, or a good cleaning, to say the least. I'll NEVER stay there.   Management was extremely inhospitable, rude and unaccommodating. I actually preferred forfeiting my $300.00 deposit rather than argue with management, there was no way we could've stayed in such an offensive place.   We left and found a beautiful B&B,  a few doors down, which has been renovated and has better views. We had a lovely time after all. Hooray.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that my recollection of the few minutes of our interaction is so different than yours. We only want to ensure that our guests enjoy their stay with us, and while our hotel wasn't for you, I'm happy to hear you found the right place for your stay.

Summary: I stayed at the Sea Horse while working near San Clemente for two months and I've been back for subsequent shorter trips.  I have my wife and our baby with me on these trips and the Sea Horse and Villa Del Mar (down the street, owned and operated by the same people) have been great for us.    The location is perfect for my wife while I'm at work because she can walk the stroller up to the great shops and restaurants on Del Mar or to the beach and pier.  The view is wonderful and we never closed our windows because the weather is almost always perfect.  The service is excellent.  The manager and his staff are all very accommodating and willing to go the extra mile to make sure that you are comfortable and happy with your stay.  They understand that this is not a brand new
Manager Response: We absolutely love catering to families and,of course, repeat guests! Our goal is to create a "beachy" environment where families can come to relax, have fun together, and enjoy the beautiful weather and small town feel of San Clemente. We look forward to welcoming everyone back!

Summary: The weather was warm, we never closed our balcony door. To fall asleep to the waves and wake up tho the waves, what else is there! That is if you like trains. (which we loved). Trains go by all day and night. The view is awesome! The staff is great. there is even a place to do laundry. AND Parking! Walk down the little street and eat breakfast at the beach garden cafe.  We ate there 3 days! Sunsets is a fun little bar ...the sushi is good.  Give your legs a workout and walk up the big street and find all kinds of shopping and eats. San Clemente is just a great beach town all together!  Don't miss out on it!
Manager Response: We totally agree with you - what else is there than falling asleep to the lulling sounds of waves and waking up to the same waves crashing on the seashore! One thing we've learned for sure - the train won't win everyone over, but we're certainly happy you enjoyed it. We think it's a pretty neat sight to see and enjoy that others appreciate it as well.  The Sea Horse is a family run operation; we take pride in providing our guests the best experience they can have here in San Clemente.Thanks for staying with us at the Sea Horse!  p.s. - we love welcoming guests from our home state of Arizona!

Summary Heading: By The Sea, By The Sea, By The Beautiful Sea!
Summary: Every year our group of 6 ladies gets together 2 times a year and visits different places for a reunion.  This was our place this year.  It was absolutely HEAVEN!  A 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo with a FANTASIC view of the Pacific Ocean!  We stayed in #2.  Full kitchen with utensils and dishes.  We slept at night with the both patio doors and windows open and was lulled to sleep by the sound of the surf.  If you take the Amtrak train here, it drops you off across the street at the pier.  Ate at several restaurants in the area and all were absolutely delicious.  I can recommend the Fisherman's Restaurant across the street, and Beach City restaurant across from there, as well as Avila's El Ranchito Mexican Restaurant, which you can walk to if you wish.  Be aware that there are no
Manager Response: One of the best things about the Sea Horse is that our various types of rooms are perfect for everyone's vacation - from couples looking for a romantic getaway, to families vacationing and enjoying quality time together, or, like in your case, friends getting together to have the  "girl time" they've been waiting for all year! We're so happy you and your friends enjoyed your stay with us, and that you had the chance to enjoy some of our delicious restaurants! We love recommending the best places to eat for whatever our guests are craving! Whether you want to head out and enjoy a meal in town or stay in and cook in your suite's kitchen (and enjoy the meal in your dining area against the backdrop of the Pacific Ocean), we have what you're looking for! We look forward to seeing you and your friends again!  -Sea Horse

Summary: My wife and I spent a few splendid summer days on the San Clemente seaside this summer. The Seahorse is perfectly located with the beach being a few steps away. Staff are very helpful and friendly; nearby infrastructure provides everything one needs for holiday and relaxation.  The rooms are bright and overlooking the beach. However, they could need a refurbishment - the equipment and furniture is rather basic and a bit dated (there even was hole in the bathroom wall). However, the Seahorse is reasonable priced if one takes into account the room fees in the hotels and inns nearby.  All in all I recommend the place and would love to stay there again!
Manager Response: We're so happy you and your wife were able to spend some time with us at the Sea Horse! You really can't beat the sounds of the waves and the beautiful views you get from our rooms. You're so right - everything you need to relax and have a wonderful stay in sunny San Clemente is a short walk away. You'll be pleased to know we have fixed the bathroom and are planning additional upgrades this coming season. We very much look forward to welcoming you and your wife again during your future holidays!  -Sea Horse

Summary: The Seahorse Resort has a great location!  Our room had a great view of the waves, pier, and Dana Point in the background.  The resort is on the main beach boardwalk which is close to good eats.  Adding to the San Clement beach life is the train stop.  This makes it convenient to spend the day at the beach, but challenging for guests to get a good night sleep.  The train whistle blows late into the night and again early in the morning.  The service was very good.  All of the people were friendly and welcoming.  We also received a good recommendation for a dinner and music restuarant.    The resort is more like an old cheap hotel with no frills.  Our room was clean but it had old furniture, an outdated bathroom, cheep towels, and an uncomfortable mattress.  The resort could
Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying with us, Ken! We're glad you enjoyed our dinner recommendation. We appreciate your comments on how we can improve and will do our best to update our style in the months to come. Thanks again for staying with us and we hope to see you back at our beach escape soon!  - Sea Horse

Summary: Stayed here with my husband and two young children.  Room rate was great for such an awesome view.  Loved all the space the room had as well as the full kitchen so we could make meals instead of having to go out for every meal.   Perfect location, could walk to everything we wanted to do.  Staff was super friendly.  We loved that they have beach towels and chairs to use at the beach.  Just got home 2 days ago and already discussing when we would like to go back!
Manager Response: Thanks for choosing to stay with us, SW! We're so happy you enjoyed your room and can't wait to welcome you back. Remember, our off-season rates start in mid-September, and the weather will be great!  -Sea Horse

Summary: We have been coming back to San Clemente and have stayed at The Seahorse as well as the Villa Del Mar. We stayed on the top floor - end unit of the Seahorse and had two rooms that shared a deck. We even had our dogs. Andrew and the staff are so awesome. The rooms were very comfortable. My husband and I had our own room and the three teens had the other with a full kitchen, incredible views and the best location to all the best of San Clemente. Great value and we plan to make them our "home away from home" every time we visit. We felt the price was very reasonable - especially for the location and accommodations. Nice parking also. We stayed for one week. Would definately recommend it. Thanks again.
Manager Response: Hi Julie, We're honored that you'd choose us as your "home away from home"! We're so happy you found our hotel here in beautiful San Clemente. We know it's especially comforting knowing you can bring your dogs with you - after all, they're part of the family too (that's how we feel about our big guy, Humphrey)!

Summary Heading: Casual, beachy fun with incredible pier and surf views
Summary: I have stayed at the Villa Del Mar a few times in recent years, but had never stayed at the Seahorse up the street.  It is further up the hill, so the view is a bit better.   We stayed in the 2 bedrm, 2 bth suite and it was like a roomy apartment.  There was a ton of storage and plenty of space to either sit together or have some personal  space.  The view from the master bedroom bed was of the pier.  While we were there it was a full moon and the view was incredible....the pier, electric waves, etc.  So amazing.  I loved the retro-tile (original) in the bathroom and the general feel of old school beach vacations.    What I think is also like about staying here are the owners, who are very, very personable and helpful.  If you are looking to really relax and being close to the
Manager Response: We just had an awesome full moon a couple of nights ago! We're so happy you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future! Thanks, AC.  -Sea Horse  p.s. - I agree, the view is quite spectacular!

Summary: I was a little weary of booking our vacation here because I had heard a few bad things about the management and the property. It was so close to the beach, though, we couldn't resist! When we got there, the manager welcomed us, gave us a bunch of great ideas for things to do that we had never thought of when my fiance was stationed there.   The room was clean, the view was outstanding, and it was the perfect feel for a wonderful beach vacation. I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for giving us a shot! We know we can't please everyone, but we certainly do try to make all our guests' stay as enjoyable as possible. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future!  - Sea Horse

Summary: We just had a pretty spacious studio, with a full ocean view.   Our cozy queen bed faced the ocean from the bed, we had nice balcony, wonderful location a block from the pier.  New flat screen TV, fridge, micro, opener, toaster and coffee maker.  The owners are very helpful and considerate, chairs and beach towels there for us, they offered to make reservations at local places.  My wife and I had a one night escape the week before Christmas and got a fantastic deal.  Weather was perfect, but the crashing waves would have been wonderful no matter the weather.  We loved walking to the pier and 5 great restaurants. About a half a mile up some pretty steep hills to get to dozens of great shops, restaurants and some pretty decent nite life.  We are looking into getting a one or two

Location is amazing - beautiful views of the beach.  Room tired - A/C broken - Fridge broken - furniture warn - TV not progammed properly.  But smokers beware - obviously you can't smoke in the room - I have no problem with that - but they expect you to cross the street to a park.  All the restaurants on the strip have ashtrays outside so that their customers can smoke on the sidewalk.  Sorry - but when I'm harassed for smoking a legal product on the public sidewalk off the property - its gone too far.....

Summary Heading: Got robbed Do not stay here !
Summary: Do not stay here the place is nasty. Our room got robbed the last day we stay there. John don't give s### about us. We,ll never go back !

Excellent location looking over the ocean, beach and pier. Can people watch all day right from your own deck. Excellent cafe close by. You are right in amongst all the San Clemente beach action. Management was VERY friendly and helpful with local knowledge of best restaurants, best surfing, etc. The give you beach chairs and towels to use any time. We stayed in a large 2 bedroom condo on the third floor. Go to sleep listening to the waves. Very clean. Lots of room. San Clemente is a great beach town with tons to see and do, lots of great little cafes, restaurants, shops. The local wine shop is great. Can walk right across the street to the beach. Great location for a family or a group of friends.

Summary Heading: I'd return, but it could use an upgrade
Summary: Rooms are very dated.  Countertops and bathroom tile are updated, but kitchen and bathroom cabinets need a definite upgrade.  I didn't want to put things in drawers. Safety features not in place. Room only locks with a deadbolt (no doorknob lock) and you can only get 2 keys which was problem when people wanted to go out separately.  Smoke detector in pieces (cover in a drawer) and didn't look like any worked.  Doesn't appear that the rooms are maintained, only cleaned.  Parking was difficult.  But I would return because the location and view were so incredible.  Kitchen is fully stocked with utensils, plates and cookware.  Toaster, microwave and coffeepot in kitchen, but NO HAIR DRYER!!  I haven't packed a hair dryer in years. I was happy to find ceiling fans.

Initially, I planned this few night business retreat to stow away with no required distraction of the local scenery.  Curiously, it fueled my spirit and increased my productivity as I rewrote our organizational strategy.  Andrew and the Seahorse Resort Team have an amazingly chill vibe and are amazing hosts.  From my local trail run to my few days of gluttonous feasting at great restaurants at their recommendation, they helped to shape an unexpected and unbeatable experience.    My Ocean front view was a welcome distraction at moments from my work, with quiet calm of the blue ocean and skies in the near distance.  The studio was immaculate with it's hip furnishings.  I loved the ground floor unit with its own furnished deck.
The perfect place to stay to be close to the beach and a nice stroll up to the town.  Very satisfied with the young men who worked there.  They were extremely accommodating.

Summary Heading: On the beach by the pier.  Warm.  That alone is enough.
Summary: I stayed in an efficiency with a balcony.  Great location.  Thought crossed my mind to rent for the rest of the month and get a part-time job nearby.  I love the sound of a train, so that isn't a problem for me.  If you don't want a few stairs, (8 max at a flight here) don't come to San Clemente. It is definately not handicapped friendly down by the beach/pier. Very steep and curving narrow streets.   Quite nice,  and very clean.  Bring your own food, coffee, condiments, etc.  Microwave, toaster and coffee maker, but no silverware, plates etc.  Plan ahead and you will love it.  Small place for laundry,  very convenient. Buy laundry detergent, too.  Don't go to laundramat on Victoria.  Broken, steals your money.  General store next door has just about whatever you need.    I

We've been staying at the Sea Horse every October for over ten years. It's perfect for a family. Our favorite 2 bedroom suite is #2. The large living, dining, kitchen area has fantastic views of the beach, pier and ocean. On clear days we can see Catalina Island. Besides being on the beach, Disneyland is just 30 minutes to the north. Legoland is 30 minutes to the south. The 2.5 mile beachfront path is perfect for our Grand Kids for walking and riding their bikes. They also love watching the Amtrak trains which stop several times a day at the pier. Though we cook most of our meals in our kitchen, there is a choice of several restaurants. Our favorite is The Fisherman. We always have at least one Sunset Dinner there.

I booked a room at this hotel and upon check in they said they made a mistake and it would be almost 100.00 more per night!!  WOW!!!  Unbelievable!!!  I don't know how they can do this when it is booked with a confirmation number.  They apologized and said they had made a mistake.  Because THEY made the mistake, YOU WOULD think they would take the hit!!!  Not us!!    No a fun situation when you are on vacation and this happens!!!  The Seahorse should of honored the rate!!!  Bottom line!
Manager Response: The seahorse Resort provides a confirmation Email to all reservations made. This email includes all viable information involved with each reservation. We do this so the customer knows what they are getting before they arrive. If this customer would have brought their confirmation printout with the specific rate they say they were qouted, we would have honored that rate. In fact we have email confirmations so we can avoid this exact problem. We are a small family run business and work with people as much as we can, it is unfortunet this customer had a bad experience.

Summary: My family and I wound up at the Seahorse resort after our vacation rental fell through.  Andrew was very accommodating to our situation.  We stayed in the two bedroom suite and had a great time.  Staff and housekeeping crew were great.  Fresh beach towels, and chairs whenever we needed them.  We had several friends and relatives visit.  The two balconies were helpful and gave us the extra space we needed.  We originally went to San Clemente after booking a different "on line" owner type vacation rental that turned out to be HORRIBLE… Andrew helped us out in a bind and ended up turning a potential nightmare into a very memorable family trip.. again, thanks Andrew and thanks Seahorse Resort Staff.   Try the crepe place down the street... you'll like it

Summary Heading: Stayed in nicer places in third world hostels.
Summary: My husband went to specifically ask and view a room because it was our anniversary.  Of course, he could not see the room prior to renting as it was "in use."  We had a view of banana trees, the doorknob literally fell off in our hands, patched hole in the front door, terrible bed, no screens, patio door didn't lock, noisy, dirty, moldy and waaayyyy tooo expensive!  The management didn't seem to care at all that the quality of our room was greatly below our expectations (which were based on my husband's discussion PRIOR to renting.)  The only thing that didn't look original to the unit was the television near the couch.  One of the kitchen cabinets was wedged shut with a piece of paper and didn't stay closed.  It was ugly!

Summary Heading: Comfortable eccentric or aging dump - it's up to you
Summary: From previous reviews this hotel appears to be one of those that people either love or hate. After staying there for 3 nights, I can understand why. Of course, the location is perfect and for many that makes up for the other imperfections. Overall, I'd say that worked for me, too.   I stayed in the Catalina room, which is one of the two on the ground floor (actually right off the street). These are less expensive and, for $170/night seem a very good value considering the location right at the pier and with lovely views. The room was a good size for two, with a small bathroom. It had a small microwave and fridge and a few dishes, but it was difficult to wash the dishes out in the tiny sink with no dish liquid, and the maid didn't do it for me. The furniture was, for me, that

The Sea Horse is a place I stayed in 1990 as a Camp Pendleton Marine.  Here we are again, twenty years later.  This time, my bride and I returned as a loving couple looking to get away for some peace and time together - 6 days total.  San Clemente has always been a favorite place for me.  At the Sea Horse you are practically on the beach and within walking distance to everything you need.  We took the Amtrak from San Diego and were in our room within 5 minutes.    The Catalina (our room) and Sunset suites are street level and have a great porch with furniture  for watching sunsets and people walking by.  The staff are responsive and friendly.  We wanted for nothing.  It isn't a Marriott, but the accomodations are cozy, and they were affordable.  You can stroll down the sidewalk

Summary Heading: Awesome views and super relaxing atmosphere
Summary: We fell in love with the Sea Horse Resort!  From the moment we put the key in the door to the moment we had to go back home....the view from our panoramic-window room was "to die for"....the spacious rooms (kitchen, livingroom, bedroom...were soooo much better than a normal "hotel" room...easy access to anywhere you want to go.  Friendly service, all the amenities you need.  We will definitely return to this romantic getaway as often as we can!

San Clemente is a wonderful small town beach community with lots of things to do.  Staying at the Seahorse Inn is also just that.  It has a wonderful view of the sea with lots of sitting places to take it all in.  The rooms are not the Four Seasons, but that's what makes the place so down-to-earth and comfortable.  Also, the owner and the rest of the staff are very accommodating, and they willing to help you find just the right room and at a reasonable rate.  I would highly recommend this place to family, friends, and anyone else thinking about a going to San Clemente.

We've been coming here since 1998. When my 6 year old Grand Daughter walked through the door she said,"I love this place." She's been here with us several times. We always stay in the same 2 bedroom condo unit on the 2nd floor. The view from the living/dining area is fabulous.  This is a beach place and shows some wear from beach weather. But the furniture, carpets, beds are in top shape. The staff are terrific people who insure that we are comfortable and our needs met.  San Clemente is the queen of California beach towns and we'd stay no other place when we're here.

My husband and I and our two boys, 11 and 14 stayed there for 3 nights recently and were very happy.  Our 2 bedroom 2 bath place was roomy and comfortable.  Even with our fan blowing on us we could still hear the waves all night and day from the bedroom and every room in our place.  The Amtrack and Surfliner trains come thru and stop almost in front of the place but everything else was too nice to let the train whistle really bother us.  There is an AWESOME crepe restaurant a few doors down that is TO DIE FOR.  The town is quaint and not loud and busy at night, which we really liked.

Summary Heading: Perfect beach location, very roomy, great view!
Summary: We went with family, 7 people total, and there was PLENTY of room.  It was the perfect location right across from the beach, and the family that runs the place is very nice and accomodating.  All amenities we needed were included, including beach towels, lounge chairs, beach umbrellas, full kitchen, extra sleeping mats, and easy parking.  Perfect for a few days of relaxation!  The main street shops are very close by, within walking distance as well.  We will definitely be back with a big group of family!  If you happen to be there during OceanFest like we were, it is a great weekend with lots of activities and competitions!

Cannot beat the view.. You can take a picture and make a post card out of it.  Found San Clemente by the pier to very clean. The streets, beach, restaurants etc. We had a small pet so the resort was perfect for the dog.  The resort itself  is in the process of updating its accomodations. Our room was not that great but it worked for the two days.  The noise was the negative.  Ok with the train which comes by every so often.  What bothered me was all the commercial trucks (diesal) driving on the Avenida Victoria street. It goes on from 7-5 . However, it does settle down at night .

Summary Heading: wonderful place, one of the nicest I've stayed in
Summary: I found this place at the very last minute - arrived in San Clemente booked to stay somewhere else, which turned out to be miles from the pier, and I had no car. I wandered down the beachfront area and came across the Seahorse, I shall be eternally glad I did.   I was in a one bedroom suite on the top floor, giant windows all around the front, gorgeous view and you could hear the ocean all the time. The apartment was beautifully done out, comfortable new furniture and very modern kitchen. The balcony overlooks the ocean also.  The suite's very nice bedroom at the back faced away from the beach, but an extra (very comfortable) bed had been placed in the main room, overlooking the ocean. I thought the main room so lovely I slept in there and had the sound of the ocean all night -

Buyer Beware - there is a reason there is a 30 day cancellation policy!  The quality of the rooms here is wildly inconsistent - hence the reviews you see on this site.  There are some corner rooms that are very nice and remodeled and then some other rooms that have not been remodeled and were built as handyman specials....plywood cabinets - dirty contact paper on shelving etc...  We stayed one night in a "remodeled" room  with no airconditioning and no windows during a summer "heat wave". There was the option to leave the front door open for ventilation and to catch the sea breeze however the front door opened right onto a sidewalk on a fairly busy street - so while this was an option while we were awake we did not feel as if we could comfortably go to sleep with the front door

We booked the seahorse the night before we left, I should have known that to be a sign. We wanted to be closer to the beach so we canceled our other reservation and booked the one bedroom with no patio to save a few dollars. (229.00) The only thing that had been remodeled in the last 30 years was the carpeting and tile. the windows had no screens, the blinds did not work. My husband had to tie a knot in the blind and wrap it around the lamp so it would stay up so we could see our view of the ocean and pier.  The shower head was so bad, had to be original to the building. The bedroom had no tv, no mirror and the mattress was so bad had to be 30 years old. i didnt even want to touch it let alone sleep in it. What we thought was a cool, sleepy beach town was a nightmare. trains
The management was great.  The room was great.  The view was great.  We will be back very soon.  I think this will be a yearly vacation spot for us.

My husband and I took a last minute vacation to San Clemente. We looked on Expedia and Travelocity for hotels .  PRICE The prices seemed very reasonable. We visited the hotel website and decided to call direct. I was given a price $60 less than quoted on any travel website by the attendant at the hotel.  LOCATION  The hotel is right across the street from the beach, with a wonderful view. Parking was a little tight, but not bad at all. There are great local restaurants in walking distance for breakfast, lunch and dinner, but be prepared to pay cash at the mom-n-pop restaurants. This is a multi-level boutique hotel. There is no elevator, and many stairs to travel. We did not find it an inconvenience.  ROOM We stayed in 5A, a studio room with a balcony facing the ocean. We ended

My wife and I drove out from AZ for the weekend stay for Valentines Weekend. The hotel offered us a great last minute rate, we were placed on a top floor one bedroom suite (5A) which had amazing ocean, pier, and coast line views.  In a last minute booking the hotel was accomodating in recieving a bouquet of flowers and a gift basket I prearranged online and had it sent to the hotel before our arrival. When we got their the presentation floored my wife and it was the beginning of a great weekend. We will be back for more this summer. I encourage everyone to experience for themselves.   Armando Garcia

I just have to say that staying at the Sea Horse was a wonderful experience in every way! I stayed in a one bedroom suite with my boyfriend.  We are from Arizona and wanted a nice weekend getaway, and we got so much more!  Not only is San Clemente the perfect  little escape town, but the people we met were all so kind.  The managers at the hotel, a husband and wife, were very inviting and made sure our stay was the best it could be.  They really made us feel at home. They gave us excellent restuarant recommendations and also provided us with beach towels and an umbrella! The room was spectacular! We had an amazing ocean view and a perfect sized balcony! The room was very clean and it had a great-sized kitchen. Everything about our stay was perfect - a great romantic weekend!  We

Summary Heading: The trip of a lifetime turned huge disappointment!
Summary: My sisters and I took our Mother to California for a trip of a lifetime. Our mother is very sick and had never seen the Pacific Ocean or California. We had hoped for a room on the beach where our mother could go in and out of the patio doors and rest as needed. We wanted it to be a wonderful experience for all of us as it will be the only time the four of us can travel together. Upon arrival, after 12 hours of traveling, we found our room to be smelly, with furniture that had a hole in the loveseat, a patio door with no screen, no airconditioning, and the ultimate was the toilet overflowed with hot water! All of this for a discount deal of 229 per night! The entrance was in the back parking lot with numerous stairs to the front of the building. From there you had to cross the

We arrived at the Seahorse Resort after a long 4hour flight, we had been looking forward to this trip and were impressed by the photos on the hotels website. Unfortunetly to our dismay, we arrived to find holes worn in the carpeting, a large hole in the couch, mold growing in the windows and a toilet overflowing in the bathroom.There were also no screens on the windows, and they didn't close! I wish we had photographed the suite so others could see the worn -out  filthy condition of this place. Don't waste your money here! Also there is no staff after 8 pm. so you are on your own. We immediately left this  place for the Hampton Inn, where we enjoyed 5 days of imaculate surroundings, and great service at half the price the Seahorse charges!

There is only one way to truly capture the beauty of San Clemnte and it is at the Seahorse resort. The hotel is sitituated perfectly opposite the ocean in walking distance to local shops and restauraunts.
