When I first read some of the revies and saw some people who put not so nice comments I felt as though I had to see for myself. The owner Marc was more than helpful in allowing me to see my room (Catalina Suite) before my stay. It is amazing with a small front porch perfect for the family to have a bite to eat on while ejoying the ocean views. The room is bright and airy and freshly remodled. I couldnt have been happier and I hope you too are able to expierience what the Seahorse has to offer.
This was the most dismal place ever. Dirty furniture, the carpets disgustingly filthy.  Stay away!!

My fiance and I stayed at the seahorse on Valentine's Day. We made the reservation on the 13th and were shocked that there was still hotel rooms available. The manager asked us what time we would be checking in. I told him around one if that was possible. He said that it would be fine (I believe normal check in was around four). The Manager was always very friendly and seemed to truly appreciate our business but there were things wrong with the room. I'm going to list below the pro's and the con's.   Pro's  Great ocean view Very nice staff Spacious Room Kitchenette Day bed by the window (so that you can look out at the ocean view) Small Patio A door divides the living room from the bedroom and the daybed is ample for children.  Con's  Shower only Very strong must odor (i'm a

My husband and I spent one night here on a surf trip up the coast.  You can't beat the location but the hotel needs major updating.  The room smelled old and I don't think anything was updated since the 50's, even the bedsheets.  This is a good place to stay with kids or friends on a surf trip.  Not a romantic hotel room or for any travelers looking for the luxuries of even a 3 star hotel.

the views here are wonderful! Unlike some of the terrible reviews of this hotel, my room was very clean and well kept. It was worth the trip just for the breathtaking view from the 2 bedroom suite we had.
Kids loved being so close to the beach.  This was our third summer.

The Sea Horse is a quaint little hotel in a great location and a great little town.  We stayed in the Balboa suite, and the view was outstanding!  Don't expect luxuary when you stay here, because you won't get it.  But if you just want great sunsets, good customer service, and a great atmosphere, this is the place for you.

Summary Heading: Most Beautiful Location in the Country
Summary: This quaint boutique hotel in the heart of Orange County holds the best views in the country! I have traveled around the world, and this location is the best that I have come across in the United States. A cozy little Spanish village, nestled close to all different types of attractions makes this place appealing to any type traveler. You get a small town feel from the friendly managers that run the hotel. It is hard to find a place where anything is given for free anymore, but at this hotel they are quick to offer amenities for the beach. You feel like you are at home and definately not at a hotel when you stay here. It is IMPOSSIBLE not to be happy at this location. Between the spectacular views and beautiful sunsets no matter how long your stay, you will not want to leave.

The Seahorse Resort and Hotel is a great place to stay, this is our second visit and the ocean view and custormer service was extraordinary. We our planning another trip in July.....A must visit hotel and resort..

Summary Heading: The worst place that I have ever stayed
Summary: I find it difficult to express, adequately, and in words, how horrible a place the Seahorse Resort is. The accommodations are poorly maintained; the towels and bedding are dirty and full of holes. The units smell awefully of mold and mildew and the managers are nasty and uninterested in the condition of the units. I felt as though I was staying in a slum unit. Additionally, they permit unlimited numbers of people in certain units, with some sleeping on terraces. This place violates an unusual number of board of health and occupancy rules.

The Sea Horse Resort in San Clemente, CA is one of the most disgusting, disgraceful, and unhealthy accommodation at which I have every stayed.  The bathroom is full of mold and mildew.  The towels are torn and shabby. The closet in the bedroom has a stench that is truly gross.  The kitchenware is sticky.  The furniture is worn and smells.  Doors are full of holes. I would hardly call this a resort.
